page.title: 04CONSERVATION MANAGEMENT,RHUM
page.content: Apart from maintenance & basic support to the community, effort is mainly directed towards creative conservation management.This springs from the original intent of improving biolog- ical productivity after centuries of ecological impoverishment by clear- ance,burning & over-grazing.In 1985 a programme aimed at simulating original Hebridean woodland commenced.To date over 2000 acres have been afforested with c.700000 trees & shrubs of 20 species.In 1985 re-planting of native woodland flora began.Cattle were re- introduced in 1972 to improve & main- tain grassland at Harris & Guirdil.The Sea Eagle programme began in 1975_the first breeding success may occur in 1985. Rhum is one of the most costly Reserves in Britain, but because of extensive research and creative manage ment use, is one of the most exciting.
